analyzed: des sems can thams cad la phog slar yang 'od zer spros pas de dag gi snying gar zhugs par blta zhing /

analyzed: de nas slar yang sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin rnams kyi gtor ma'i snod yongs su bkang la /
translated: Then, again, one should visualize that the light rays that arise from the seed syllable, which are of the nature of nectar, fill the offering vessel.

analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re mu:zhes pas gshegs su gsol lo //

analyzed: rim pa 'dis thun mtshams bzhir bsgoms na myur bar dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meditates in four sessions with this process, one will quickly attain spiritual powers.

analyzed: da ni bsrung ba'i sbyor ba cung zad bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now I will explain a little the practice of protection.

translated: The yogi who recites the root mantra ten hundred thousand times in the manner explained above, abiding in the meditative stabilization of Tārā, should recite the mantra as before in the rite of recitation, except that he should imagine the name of the person to be benefited at the head of the mantra.

original: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'dod kyi bar du bya'o //

analyzed: de nas sa bon gyi yi ge las 'od zer byung bas bsgrub ya'i lus thams cad khyab par bltas te /
translated: Then, light rays come from the seed syllable and pervade the entire body of the person to be benefited.

analyzed: des lus rab tu tshim par gyur cing nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral bar mos par bya'o //

translated: The yogi who is endowed with the previous rite should imagine a green tāṃ or laṃ in his heart, with a garland of light rays swirling around it.

original: de las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs 'bar bas gdug pa'i lus gcer bu skra grol ba 'dra zhing skyabs dang bral ba'i snying gar zhugs pas de rengs pa dang mnan pa dang / rmongs pa dang / bcings par rnam par bsam mo //

translated: The blazing mass of light rays that arise from that enter the heart of the naked, loose-haired, fearful body of the wicked one, and one should imagine that he is paralyzed, suppressed, confused, and bound.

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jigs pa dang bral ba na mdud pa slar dgrol bar bya'o //

translated: I have composed this sādhana ritual well.🔽May it quickly lead all beings to the glorious Potala,🔽the abode of Tārā and her retinue.

analyzed: gru 'dzin dpal du 'gro rnams myur 'gro shog /'phags ma sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs dpal mar me mdzad ye shes kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Noble Tārā composed by Śrī Dīpaṃkara-jñāna is complete.
